title: European greenhouse gas emissions decline but land stores weaken
summary: According to recent research, Europe’s net greenhouse gas emissions have decreased by around 25% since the 1990s. While this is good news, the study also revealed a weakening in the capacity of land and vegetation to absorb and store atmospheric carbon.

title: Key Moments Lead to Fulfilling NASA Stennis Career
summary: Joseph Ladner’s experiences working at NASA’s Stennis Space Center near Bay St. Louis, Mississippi, motivate him to “pay it forward” so more people can be a part of something great. “It is exciting to be at a place like NASA Stennis that continues to reinvent itself to stay relevant,” Ladner said. “You can do just […]

title: Slow Burn: How Starliner’s crewed test flight went awry
summary: When NASA and Boeing officials walked into the briefing room at the Kennedy Space Center on June 5, they were all smiles. After years of development setbacks, weeks of delays […]

title: Atlas sets course to triple sales after raising $15 million
summary: Ground station services provider Atlas Space Operations said Sept. 4 it has raised $15 million for the working capital needed to triple revenue over the next 12 months.

title: Relativity Space has gone from printing money and rockets to doing what, exactly?
summary: "I would rather make that decision than pathologically hold on to something."

title: Benchmark wins $4.9 million award for ASCENT propulsion systems
summary: SAN FRANCISCO – The Air Force Research Laboratory awarded Benchmark Space Systems $4.9 million to develop propulsion systems for ASCENT monopropellant. The two-year award announced Sept. 5 covers development of […]

title: Sierra Space completes acoustics tests of Dream Chaser cargo module
summary: Sierra Space has completed tests of one element of the first Dream Chaser cargo spacecraft ahead of a delayed launch to the International Space Station.

title: Research Plane Dons New Colors for NASA Hybrid Electric Flight Tests

title: MaiaSpace Prepares to Start Hot Fire Testing in 2025
summary: French launch startup MaiaSpace has announced that it is preparing to conduct the first hot fire test of the upper stage of its Maia rocket in 2025. MaiaSpace is a wholly-owned subsidiary of ArianeGroup that was created in late 2021. The company is developing a partially reusable two-stage rocket called Maia that will be capable […]
